data.title: Color Correction Documentation and LUTIdentity
data.body:
I was playing around and trying to customize my scene and thought of doing color grading and correction but I found little or no documentation on how to apply or generate these texture ramps like the default LUTIdentity.png/xml.

I do have some color ramp packs (converted to 1x64) that I would like to try and use with my scene so I think adding more information or guide on this section would help doing those final touches on screen.

Reference:
https://www.unrealengine.com/content/dae6d4fecc4c4d2e89f21d25c09aee17
http://docs.garagegames.com/torque-3d/official/content/documentation/Artist%20Guide/Tutorials/PostFXColorCorrection.html

data.title: doc generation pollutes source tree
data.body:
Urho3D/docs/CMakeLists.txt dumps the following files into Urho3D/docs
  AngelScriptAPI.h
  ScriptAPI.dox
  LuaScriptAPI.dox
This is done deliberately with a CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR directory.  The comments talk about "desired" side effects from doing this.  However it's creating at least 2 undesired side effects.  1) CMake builds are generally intended to allow so-called "out of source" builds where the source tree is left pristine.  This allows the CMake build master to delete the build directory and start over clean.  2) the dump messes up "git pull".  It complains about new local files that need to be resolved.  Both of these side effects are annoying.  Please find a clean way to implement the desired build dependencies.

Hello!

I want to try to use Urho3D on Jolla Sailfish OS which is arm linux factually. How could I change cmake files for building Urho3D for armv7h platform?

Thanks in advance!

data.title: Animation freezes when AnimatedModel's "update when invisible" is false
data.body:
I'm using Urho3D 1.4

It seems AnimatedModel freezes when the model is out of the view and non-looping animation has ended. (didn't test the non-looping part, only out of view)

Freezes means when the model goes back into the view and the animation is already over(not confirmed) it won't update to the end of the animation.

For example, in the following image all the monsters should lay dead but some of them are frozen (they can kill each other by infighting while the player looks away):
![ss 2015-09-04 at 04 58 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7088062/9675483/abfbd1fe-52c6-11e5-9b63-9390f60fa6e5.jpg)

Setting "update when invisible" to true fixes this problem, but the behavior is still undesirable, and updating once when the model becomes visible again might solve this so the optimization can still be used.

data.title: Added flag to enable/disable animations being auto-removed when weight is zero
data.body: As the title says; I added a flag and associated functions to allow the `AnimationController`-controlled animations to be automatically removed (current behavior) or not as the user chooses. This is to aid functionality with some different animation techniques, especially with my implementation of an animation state machine where animations need to be persistent.

data.title: Consider searching EMSCRIPTEN_ROOT_PATH from EMSCRIPTEN env. var?
data.body:
Hi,

when using the Emscripten SDK, sourcing the `emsdk_env` script will get one into an Emscripten build environment. In this environment, there's a standard `EMSCRIPTEN` environment variable that points to the directory where `emcc` resides in. I notice when building that `cmake_emscripten.bat` was not able to find Emscripten directly via that. Perhaps if user doesn't set `-DEMSCRIPTEN_ROOT_PATH=x` in CMake command line, then the canonical `EMSCRIPTEN` environment variable could be searched?

data.title: Shader compilation error due to replacing "attribute" with "// attribute"
data.body:
On OpenGL "attribute" is replaced with "// attrbute" here: 

https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Graphics/Shader.cpp#L105

Which changes the GLSL to "#define // attribute in" here: 

https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/bin/CoreData/Shaders/GLSL/Transform.glsl#L5

Some GLSL compilers error on an empty define

data.body: Someone forgot to put "private:" before data section.

data.title: Crash with ATI Radeon HD 5770
data.body:
I gave some guy a build of my project to test, and it crashed on launch.
His graphics card is Radeon HD 5770.
Using "-gl2" solved the problem.

The card's spec says it supports openGL 3.2 here: http://www.amd.com/en-us/products/graphics/desktop/5000/5770

So I'm not sure why it crashes. Also I'm not sure if it's specific only to the guy that helped me test.

data.title: (FEATURE REQUEST) Using .asc file if .as is missing
data.body:
After compiling scripts

```
ScriptCompiler.exe GameData/Scripts/*.as
```

the user must rework all the scripts

```
node.CreateScriptObject("Scripts/MyScript.as", "MyScript"); -> node.CreateScriptObject("Scripts/MyScript.asc", "MyScript");
```

and all the scenes

```
<attribute name="Script File" value="ScriptFile;Scripts/Cannon.as" /> -> <attribute name="Script File" value="ScriptFile;Scripts/Cannon.asc" />
```

It is very inconveniently.

data.title: Node::SetEnabledRecursive logic error?
data.body:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Scene/Node.cpp#L1625

According to the code it saves the state that you are about to set it into, instead of saving previous state. Is this working as intended, or should it be:
enabledPrev_ = enabled_;

So that it saves the state it was before the change?

Also I noticed that in documentation:
http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/class_urho3_d_1_1_node.html#a3076ab3fed8d3a873149e1a380f79ad0

It says exactly opposite from setdeepenabled and setenabledrecursive. The SetEnabledRecursive is the one that has true for storeself and deep one false in the code.

Edit: Now that I read the document more accurately. It does actually work as intended, where SetEnabledRecursive saves the state it is going to be set, instead of saving the state it was before setting.

data.title: Dropdownlist and invalid pointer
data.body: On at least my system (Windows 10 + VS2013), when I add dropdownlist to the UI, then click the dropdownlist so that the menu is visible and press the X-button on the window to close the game, it crashes on closing.

data.title: Configurable texture binding
data.body:
Add some method of configuration to specify which textures for a shader technique's pass should be bound, defaulting to "all" and with an easy out of "none."

---

I made a quick and dirty pass at adding a "textures" attribute to Technique passes to filter what textures should be bound for which passes.

The reasons for this were to avoid texture binding during shadow passes (or just bind the diffuse for alphamask techniques), specifically to compensate for integrated GPUs which have limited dedicated vram so unnecessary binds hurt more as the textures will realistically never be in vram.

From the built in DX11 profiling in VS2013:
Gains for shadow rendering were 15% on Intel HD4000 & HD4400 (smidge higher results), going down to around 8-10% for just binding diffuse for alphamask. For 3 4096x4096 textures, results were lesser on smaller sizes.

I'm not sure my implementation is great enough to warrant a PR however, it's basically just passing a PODVector<TextureUnit> from the pass by pointer to batch drawing, if null then bind everything (a magic "all" was checked for first), if not null check size for whether to bind anything and if size is > 0 check the contents for what to bind.

data.title: Variants set from a number in Lua default to VAR_DOUBLE
data.body:
If you, for instance, write the line of code vm["key"]=node:GetID() in Lua script as part of an event being sent, if the receiver of the event is C++ code, then the value of "key" must be read back using vm["key"]:GetDouble() then cast to unsigned int for use as a node ID. Similarly, any numbers set to a variant in Lua will default to a type of VAR_DOUBLE. If you try to read it back using GetUInt() the method returns 0.

I understand why this is (Lua only knows about doubles) but it's still kind of inconvenient and bug prone.

What about a change to the various GetDouble, GetFloat, GetInt, GetUInt methods of Variant that will perform appropriate casting as needed? ie, a Variant can be set to a VAR_DOUBLE type, but calling GetUInt() on it will perform a cast on the stored double value and return the casted value, rather than defaulting to returning 0 because it's not the right type?

I know this really isn't an optimal solution either (prone to all the possible errors that can be introduced from casting between types of different bit sizes) but it might be better than the current default of returning 0.

What think you all?
